body:
> You can get the error code from $e->errorInfo[1]

That does NOT give you any right or reason to render perfectly good SQLSTATE value into a broken and useless integer in the `\yii\db\Exception::getCode()`.
Traced it down to 2011. We're doing so at least since Yii 1.1: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii/blob/master/framework/db/CDbCommand.php#L219 :)
We're not relying on code anywhere but I wonder if third party code does...

issue.title: Use string as error code
issue.body:
Since that's what PDO uses and we're wrapping around it.

body:
I think this could be down to inheritance of `Exception` which expects numeric error codes (for use with http error codes?).

If the `(int)` cast was removed you could use `$exceptionMap`.

https://www.php.net/manual/en/exception.getcode.php:

> Returns the exception code as integer in Exception but possibly as other type in Exception descendants (for example as string in PDOException).

So having non-int is fine. My only concern is backwards compatibility.
Thought more about it. Decided to do it and mention it in UPGRADE.md.

It still occurs when Connection errors are thrown such as HYT00 which is being cast as 0.

It is mainly visible whenever you have timeout or internet issues between your Yii2 app and your database.

The culprit seems to be this line which still cast the error code as an int: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/079ca8f647a9592c3269e0d4dec164f3533e1409/framework/db/Connection.php#L647
Please report it as a new issue.

Following up my comment from here : https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/18203#issuecomment-1163184592

Similarly to what used to happens on SQL queries, https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/079ca8f647a9592c3269e0d4dec164f3533e1409/framework/db/Connection.php#L647 and https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/079ca8f647a9592c3269e0d4dec164f3533e1409/framework/db/Command.php#L272 are still casting the SQL error code to an INT which loses data in case of DB timeout.


### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Generating any Connection error will result in this behaviour (Internet loss, timeout, etc)

### What is the expected result?

HYT00

### What do you get instead?

0
